New Eye-Tracking Study Published

February 9, 2026 • Aaron Khodami, Ph.D

News Vision Science Publication

In Brief: We are pleased to announce our latest study on peripheral vision and attention has been published in the Journal of Vision.

We are pleased to announce our latest study on peripheral vision and attention has been published in the Journal of Vision. This work challenges existing models of how we allocate attention in cluttered environments.

Key Findings

  1. Peripheral vision is not merely a blurred version of central vision.
  2. Attention can be allocated to feature-based object representations even in the far periphery.
  3. Our computational model predicts human performance with 95% accuracy.

Heatmap showing gaze distribution during the visual search task.

Future Directions

We are now extending this work to dynamic scenes to understand how these mechanisms operate in real-world environments like driving or sports.

Read the full paper here
